intro: Hieracium maculatum subsp. onosmotrichum, commonly known as the spotted hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive spotted or mottled appearance, contributing to its common name. This subspecies is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomatous growth.
